body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce

So initially this worked, but I have a bigger project with multiple modules based on on either flutter or java (for API development), like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136531578-1a68e098-e98d-49ef-83f3-7e4a076d9a09.png)

Initially the main project SDK was set to Android and I added a flutter app and it worked, but with adding some java modules I switched main project SDK to JDK and worked on those apis, today I tried to test again mobile app with latest APIs, but it says:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136532012-867cb790-9127-4ba2-abc7-1f658c2571f5.png)

When I open AVD manager I can start the emulator without issues:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136532180-fd96dbfc-11ee-465b-b267-a64842c18e6e.png)

I tried to connect directly to phone via wifi, by:
over USB do: 
[11:33:23] zangetsu@zeus ÓÇ∞ $ ÓÇ∞ ~ ÓÇ∞ adb tcpip 5555
restarting in TCP mode port: 5555
And then: 
[11:33:28] zangetsu@zeus ÓÇ∞ $ ÓÇ∞ ~ ÓÇ∞ adb connect 192.168.88.97:5555
connected to 192.168.88.97:5555

No, my phone is directly visible in idea, but same result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136533748-edce605d-f31c-4405-86b6-d9e906e23c9d.png)

My project SDK settings, I switched back from JDK to Android SDK:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136533852-45419e4d-5dd0-485a-9eca-f5df37b7229d.png)

And also configured it on module itself:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136534062-508ed18c-5858-47dd-843b-f785f5e21cd2.png)

I am watching idea log, but don't see much..

When running manually from command-line it works:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136538284-be6baf8c-2acb-42fa-9549-ac7a52cbea53.png)


## Version info

[‚úì] Flutter (Channel master, 2.6.0-12.0.pre.222, on Gentoo/Linux 5.13.10-gentoo-x86_64, locale en_US.utf8)
    ‚Ä¢ Flutter version 2.6.0-12.0.pre.222 at /data/proj/private/flutter
    ‚Ä¢ Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git
    ‚Ä¢ Framework revision ed60103645 (2 days ago), 2021-10-06 06:53:04 -0400
    ‚Ä¢ Engine revision f967ebb685
    ‚Ä¢ Dart version 2.15.0 (build 2.15.0-178.0.dev)

[‚úì] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 31.0.0)
    ‚Ä¢ Android SDK at /data/devel/sdk/android
    ‚Ä¢ Platform android-31, build-tools 31.0.0
    ‚Ä¢ ANDROID_HOME = /data/devel/sdk/android
    ‚Ä¢ ANDROID_SDK_ROOT = /data/devel/sdk/android
    ‚Ä¢ Java binary at: /opt/android-studio/jre/bin/java
    ‚Ä¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.10+0-b96-7249189)
    ‚Ä¢ All Android licenses accepted.

[‚úì] Chrome - develop for the web
    ‚Ä¢ CHROME_EXECUTABLE = /usr/bin/google-chrome-stable

[‚úì] Linux toolchain - develop for Linux desktop
    ‚Ä¢ clang version 12.0.1

    ‚Ä¢ ninja version 1.10.2
    ‚Ä¢ pkg-config version 0.29.2

[‚úì] Android Studio (version 2020.3)

comment_data.body:
It looks like you have a monorepo project, which is not supported by the Flutter plugin. The Flutter plugin currently requires Flutter projects to be opened as top-level projects in the IDE, not as modules embedded in a larger project. This is tracked in #5291

Fortunately, it is easy to open a project in its own widow. Just choose the option to use a new window.

@stevemessick - the issue is bit elsewhere as I tried today open the module as project which didn;t work, I tried even create new flutter project, but I do not see any device in dropdow box while I started even running emulator via AVD manager window.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136648539-c6e944a2-5965-4756-89b9-8f3b3416f065.png)

But there is really nothing suspicious in the idea.log
[idea.log](https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/files/7315157/idea.log)

Here is output of 'flutter devices':
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/553512/136648808-2d94610f-e4dd-47d9-ab93-f9eea8868ba4.png)

Its bit different issue then one suggested by you.. it seems. it will be also good if the plugin can do more debug/error logging. ..

title: Unable to run Android Emulator, not applicable for ‚Äúmain.dart‚Äù configuration
